intro: Deprea longicalyx, commonly known as the long-leaved deprea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil.
